snippet: The four-week average of unemployment claims, which filters out weekly volatility, hit a seven-year low. Housing starts, however, stumbled badly, falling 9.3 percent in June to a nine-month low.
abstract: Labor Department reports that weekly claims for state unemployment benefits fell 3,000 to seasonally adjusted 302,0000; four-week average of jobless claims hits lowest level in seven years; housing starts fell for a second month in June.
lead_paragraph: The four-week average of unemployment claims, which filters out weekly volatility, hit a seven-year low. Housing starts, however, stumbled badly, falling 9.3 percent in June to a nine-month low.

headline.main: New Jobless Claims Drop, but So Do Housing Starts
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Drop, but So Do Housing Starts
